data.title: Set minimum scale value to 1
data.body:
An error occurs if an object's scale is set to 0 in any of the axis. 

`Matrix3.getInverse(): can't invert matrix, determinant is 0`

As an object cannot have a dimension scale of 0 (AFAIK), we should prevent it from being an option.

data.title: When deleting, "X is used in Y" dependency warning should use full asset paths
data.body: Not just the asset names themselves.

data.title: Reveal asset in tree view when double-clicking the tab button or opening an asset from a component editor
Move recursive asset folder deletion to server so that it's more robust
data.body: Currently it is done client-side by looping over entries and it doesn't work great.

data.title: Don't collapse new folders by default, closes #88
Add asset filtering. Fixes #71
data.body:
Took a first stab at adding asset filtering. Works pretty well but doesn't handle folders, i.e if everything in a folder is hidden I don't hide the folder (off the top of my head I think you'd have to make changes to the tree library to do this correctly).

Also I'm far from an artist/designer so the new artwork/css stylings probably need some work/rethinking :)

data.title: Offbeat preview when selecting frames for a sprite animation
data.body:
Hello everyone,

I think I've got a tiny UI problem on the sprite editor when working with animations, but it doesn't seems to affect the sprite animation system in itself.
It appeared while using a tiled sprite with 6 columns and 4 rows, but I guess you can reproduce it with a different tiled sprite.

**OS :** Windows 10 x64
**Superpowers :** 0.19.0 x64

**How to reproduce :**
1. Create a "Sprite" asset
2. Import a tiled sprite as the "Texture"
3. Set the grid size of the sprite using the "Setup" button
4. Create a new animation
5. Set the first (left) number of the animation as 0 (= the first image of the first row)
6. Increase the second (middle) number of the animation up to 6 (= the first image of the second row)

**Expected behavior :**
The purple preview layer shown over the sprite should highlight the first row (6 images) and the first image of the second row, as they're the selected sprites for the created animation.

**Encountered problem :**
The purple preview layer exeeds the first row on its right and highlights a 7th non-existent image. The animation preview at the bottom of the editor still works and understands that we want the images of the tiled sprite between indexes 0 and 6.

Here is a visual representation of the issue, I've added the sprites index myself for more clarity.
![01-29-2016 14-14-33](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1526969/12676469/cd3257fe-c692-11e5-97fd-b1338a36f13d.png)

And here's the sprite configuration for reference.
![01-29-2016 14-15-38](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1526969/12676471/d0a07164-c692-11e5-8cd0-5c5c26178c94.png)

It's my first issue report so I hope it's understandable enough. :smile: 
Cheers,

data.title: server: Fix data-path option not being passed to the start command
Deleting an asset with a scheduled save doesn't cancel scheduled save
data.body:
It looks like deleting an asset with a scheduled save doesn't cancel the scheduled save, leading to ENOENT error messages in the console.

To reproduce:
1. Create a sprite
2. Upload a texture
3. Within a minute, trash it
4. Wait 60 seconds

data.title: Error when lauching on Raspberry Pi
data.body:
Hi sparklinlabs guys,

Awesome job you did with superpowers!

I'm trying to launch superpowers as a server on a Raspberry Pi, but I get the following error :
`Cannot GET /index.view`

Yet the server logs looks normal to me: 
`node server start`
`2016-01-28 10:41:19 - Using data from /home/wassim/.local/share/Superpowers.`
`2016-01-28 10:41:19 - Server v0.19.0 starting...`
`2016-01-28 10:41:19 - Using data from /home/wassim/.local/share/Superpowers.`
`2016-01-28 10:41:19 - Server v0.19.0 starting...`
`2016-01-28 10:41:27 - Loaded 0 projects from /home/wassim/.local/share/Superpowers/projects.`
`2016-01-28 10:41:27 - Main server started on port 4237, build server started on port 4238.`
`^C`
`2016-01-28 10:43:42 - Saving all projects...`
`2016-01-28 10:43:42 - Exited cleanly.`

I also get a 404 error in my browser console `Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 404 (Not Found)`

I'm using `node v4.2.6` with Raspbian and superpowers-0.19.0-linux-ia32

If you want to see for yourself, I'll let the server run, you can access it with [here](http://www.wassimdhif.tk) with this password : superpowers

Best regards,
Wassim Dhif

data.title: When creating a folder, don't collapse it by default
data.body:
When someone creates a new folder, it is likely they'll want to add stuff inside of it, so it should be open by default (no collapsed).

In the [entry creation acknowledgement callback](https://github.com/superpowers/superpowers/blob/41e0a3b87b3a26a0ef25223658d7a3642d30b3a4/client/src/project/index.ts#L391), we should check if the entry is a folder (`data.entries.byId[id].type == null`) and if so, we should remove the `collapsed` class from the list item element.

This is a great first bug so if you want to fix it, check out [the contribution guidelines](http://docs.superpowers-html5.com/en/development/how-to-contribute) and ask for more directions if needed!

data.title: Add pt-BR translation for 'usernamePatternDescription' key.
SupClient.projectClient.editAsset/Resource should handle errors
Docs: Stuck at username question
data.body:
It feels like something is missing on http://docs.superpowers-html5.com/en/getting-started/setting-up-superpowers

I downloaded the 64-bit linux version, unzipped, and then I double-clicked the "Superpowers" executable.
The splash screen appears, I click to remove it.
I see "My Server 127.0.0.1:4237".
Double-clicking it, it asks for username. At this point the docs say: " You'll be asked to choose a username. This is not yet linked to your Superpowers account but you probably want to use the same."

So I tried some random username, but it just stays on that screen. There are no usernames listed in ~/.local/share/Superpowers/config.json   (just two ports, a blank password (which is for other people to login to your server, I assume), and `maxRecentBuilds:10`)

Aha, while typing this issue, I tried "guest" and that worked!

So: the docs need to say something like:
   Give "guest" as the username, when prompted. To add your own users [...link to instructions here...].

I think you also need to say that the server Superpowers window need to be kept open all the time.

im not sure but i guess the syntax highlight and compiler is only checking for typescript code instead of acept both js and js?

i can port my own code to typescript, but thirdyparty libraries that im using would be  PITS

data.title: Replace server-side hard-coded English error messages
data.body:
Both in `superpowers` and `superpowers-game`, we have various error messages sent by the server through callbacks that haven't been internationalized.

A couple examples:
- [RemoteProjectClient.ts](https://github.com/superpowers/superpowers/blob/master/server/RemoteProjectClient.ts#L66)
- [RemoteHubClient.ts](https://github.com/superpowers/superpowers/blob/c0d7e0ca41ef2829bb52b1a84e759e8586577b0b/server/RemoteHubClient.ts#L147)
- [SceneAsset in SupGame](https://github.com/superpowers/superpowers-game/blob/master/plugins/default/scene/data/SceneAsset.ts#L135) and most of the other asset classes

They should be replaced by localization IDs (`"namespace:some.key"`), added to [the locale files](https://github.com/superpowers/superpowers/tree/master/public/locales/en) and the client should run the IDs through `SupClient.i18n.t(...)`. Even better, it should enclose them in a descriptive string like `Could not create project: ${reason}` which should itself be locazlized.

The localized reasons should be full sentences (maybe multiple) so they should end with a full stop.

data.title: Importing assets via drag'n'drop into the asset tree
data.body:
Plugins should use `SupClient.registerPlugin` in some agreed-upon bundle (`public/bundles/import.js`?) to declare accepted media types or extensions and expose import methods.

In [client/src/project/index.ts](https://github.com/superpowers/superpowers/blob/master/client/src/project/index.ts), we can load up the `import.js` bundles for each plugin (similar to how we load [`documentation.js` bundles](https://github.com/superpowers/superpowers-game/blob/6a0c1ad3f156dc6c66ec6f8fc03fd23f80a7c127/plugins/default/documentation/editors/documentation/index.ts#L28))

Then, [in `onTreeViewDrop`](https://github.com/superpowers/superpowers/blob/63e251b76395f11928501cc886e15f2b2eae8d01/client/src/project/index.ts#L620), we should look through `event.dataTransfer.files` for media type or extensions matches.  If there are multiple matches, open a dialog to ask the user to choose what to do.

Finally, call the exposed import methods which will use `ProjectClient` to edit the project, and see assets be magically imported! :O

See also https://github.com/superpowers/superpowers-game/issues/30

client: Add an asset type filter to the project tree
data.body:
There should be a funnel button next to the search button that toggles a panel (below the asset management buttons but above the asset tree) with an icon for every asset type.
- Clicking on one of them filters the whole tree to display only that type of asset
- Right-clicking on one of them would enable/disable it (multiples can be active at once)
- There would be a "reset" button as the first icon that enables all the icons

data.title: Use ES5 strict mode?
data.body:
Should we be using [ES5 strict mode](https://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Strict_mode) for performance and/or better runtime error detection?

If so, do we need to put the `"use strict";` marker in each file? Only the entry files for Node.js? What about browserified modules? Is it enough to put it at the top of the browserify bundles, or do we need one inside each module like [strictify](https://github.com/jsdf/strictify) does?
